thread.title: Everything to know about Texas A&M-Ole Miss, including predictions, analysis, TV info and more
thread.title_full: Everything to know about Texas A&M-Ole Miss, including predictions, analysis, TV info and more | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Everything to know about Texas A&M-Ole Miss, including predictions, analysis, TV info and more
text:
No. 15 Texas A&M at no. 24 Ole Miss
This contest will operate much like an elimination game in the SEC West, with the loser kissing college football playoff hopes and likely the SEC title game goodbye. Not only will the winner stay alive in the division race, but will also claim their sixth victory of the season, good for a bowl game berth.
Both teams prefer the pass to the run. Rebels' quarterback Chad Kelly is the SEC leader in passing yards with the Aggies' Kyle Allen trailing behind in third. Ole Miss' Laquon Treadwell leads the conference in receiving yards at 654, but A&M's Christian Kirk is hot on his trail with 609.
Watch for plenty of passing in a game both teams desperately need as a win in the record books to keep the goals set for 2015 within reach. -- Brandon Wheeland
Who: No. 15 Texas A&M (5-1, 2-1 SEC) at No. 24 Ole Miss (5-2, 2-1)
When: 6 p.m. Saturday
Where: Vaught-Hemingway Stadium in Oxford, Miss.
Line: Ole Miss by 6 (as of Wednesday morning)
TV/radio: ESPN / KESN-FM (103.3)
Full coverage: Predictions, analysis and more
